If we're fighting for consensus reality and they're fracturing the notion of consensus reality, they win, period. We were not ready.

so instead of stripping the ego from "the heart" (aka part of the rap battle), kendrick tells drake to strip the ego from the bottom (his past)

but bc he knows "the metaphors don't reach [drake]", he packages this idea and addresses drake explicitly on the last line of the song: https://t.co/wEW2PKeF8z

Examining a couple of sample tweets from the outlier groups.

Accidental jhana woa
Meditation is just thinking about what it feels like to think

I'm serious here. I had this last night. Some thoughts felt good. Some thoughts felt less good. Some thought patterns were more complex, and felt really good. Then you think: how do I keep this going?

Then you find something that feels amazing and you keep thinking and shit wow full body reverberating. It stops when I start thinking about something else. Holy shit, how can thinking feel so good 

https://t.co/DJq4eCJldL

Meditation is a really fucking weird science because, it's kind of gnostic in the sense of you just need to look inwards. But it's very objective because, you are doing experiments and finding verifiable, falsifiable truth. 

thank you @LouisVArge for unlocking this for me

@LouisVArge Like, I used to have experiences and then need to read up online "am I doing it right". I don't need anyone to tell me if this is right, I KNOW something changed, I can see it. I know different things happen when I give the system diff inputs. I try to repeat it & explore further

I need your help! 

I made a weird little web app where you write down your life principles & it tries to find connections with other people's principles. I think it'd be fun to see it with more people adding stuff! 

Take a moment to share some advice?

https://t.co/BBi8clBmLf https://t.co/Jd5QPByYui

@mbateman I blame several things (1) often too much red tape to deploy a simple web app internally, even at fast moving big tech (2) people love to talk about the hot new thing in web dev. People are not aware of how simple things *can* be

@slow5ort @TisTireless what if you do a meetup or a twitter space that is JUST for everyone who has a pixel art astronaut in their pfp???? 

we have the tools to do this, a web app with twitter auth that only lets you in if a vision model can recognize it

I'm giving a talk in 8 hours, but I haven't started the slides yet, because I'm trying to make a little web app lets me live poll the audience I speak

(irresponsible? YES. Extremely fun and gets my heart racing? hell yeah!!!)

The way I will use it is, I hold my phone up on stage, or open the web app on screen. I can click "reset" to reset the answer. I will speak the question, or put it on the slides. People can answer and see the results in realtime

@JacobColling This is like a local lightning talk night. And everyone can see the results as they vote, and so can I, because my phone is in my hand (or I can put it up on screen, it's just a web app)

@workflowsauce one thing I haven't seen a lot is make the web app take an open API key, so you can go ham on usage without worrying about scalability (but of course, higher barrier to entry)

VPS instead of severless is also a good option?

"buying new light bulbs because you can't find the ones you already have in your basement"

"generating a new web app because you can't remember where you deployed it last time you generated it"
@workflowsauce but yes I'd love to see a web app where you can type anything into the "poles" and see the words reshuffle

He told me he has "no interest in" trying ChatGPT but the idea that he missed an easter egg about a movie he hasn't seen is bugging him

We think of easter egg obsession as a nostalgic Millennial YouTube-brain problem, but the only thing my Boomer dad has said (and he's mentioned it 3 times, to several different people) about The Fabelmans is "I wonder what hidden references Spielberg made to his previous films"
@SeashellDaniel @am_anatiala Looks like potter wasp nest cells to me. Not a cocoon, the egg (later a larva) and its food would be inside

@friesen5000 @CSEiseman You can imagine every time an egg gets laid on the wrong host as a chance to guess the biochemical "password" of a new plant. It takes a lot of attempts to do that successfully so hosts that smell similar, are abundant, etc, should be more likely to get new inducers
@objectivepotato egg cups are just one small element of the US v Europe living standards discourse but eg this is what I woke up to on my timeline this morning https://t.co/aNrhydTxHQ

not to do discourse but the egg cup thing is a great example of why Europeans are still poor and Americans aren't. Instead of getting on their grindset so they can afford better food they just build an infrastructure around their poverty
@Emma_Marris yeah the egg thing gets a lot of attention but it's the crawfish that stuck out for me too
@CipolliniDon I'm seeing hundreds of them, completely defoliated shrubs, trees covered in egg sacs, etc
